team2869.bethpage.robotics.aerialassist.subsystems

Class Launcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
      • team2869.bethpage.robotics.aerialassist.subsystems.Launcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NamedSendable, Sendable

    public class Launcher
extends Subsystem
    This class extends Subsystem, and controls the launcher mechanism on the robot. It consists of two Talon instances for the two winding motors on the physical launcher, as well as a release relay to shoot the ball. A limit switch regulates the winding and unwinding of this subsystem. The subsystem frequently updates to the SmartDashboard.
    Author:
    BETHPAGE HIGH SCHOOL, 2014 TEAM #2869 - HARSHIL GARG

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Launcher()
      Constructs a new Launcher, with two Talons for winding, a release relay, and a limit switch for winding regulation based on input from a Maxbotix Ultrasonic rangefinder.

        public void shoot()

      • resetShoot

        public void resetShoot()
        Resets everyhting for the next shoot.

      • calculateDistance

        public double calculateDistance()
        Calculates the distance in inches or centimeters based on a linear regression developed after testing the ultrasonic rangefinder.
        Returns:
        Distance in inches, if rangeUnit is true or centimeters, if rangeUnit is false.

      • isAbsoluteWound

        public boolean isAbsoluteWound()
        Decides if the exact target clicks and the currently wound click has an acceptable error, to increase shooting percentage. The DriveToExactClick Command will move the robot forwards until the error is minimized.
        Returns:
        True if there is an acceptable error, and false if there is not.

      • windLaunchSystem

        public void windLaunchSystem()
        Constantly winds and unwinds the system by regulating motor speeds based on the current clicks in comparison to target clicks. Called by the default Command, WinderLaunch, and other commands as well.

      • autonomousDrive

        public int autonomousDrive(double autoDistance)
        Determines the action of the drivetrain system during autonomous game mode.
        Parameters:
        autonomousDistance - The distance, in inches, that the robot should be from the goal before shooting.
        Returns:
        A positive value to indicate forward drive, zero to indicate stop (target range achieved) and a negative value to indicate backward drive.

      • autonomousDirection

        public int autonomousDirection()
        Determines which of the two goals is currently lit (at 0 seconds), and proceeds to the other goal. Method is currently incomplete.
        Returns:
        A positive value to indicate that to proceed to the right goal, and a negative value to proceed to the left goal.

      • isDoneWinding

        public boolean isDoneWinding()
        Decides if the mechanism is done winding. The winding motors must be set to zero, if currentClicks equals targetClicks. Safety check, since if the shooting mechanism is called, the other Commands would have successfully wound the mechanism by now.
        Returns:
        True if the mechanism is ready to shoot, and false if it is not.

      • updateDashboard

        public void updateDashboard()
        Updates the SmartDashboard with winder motor values, relay status, the distance to wall, and the state of the launcher mechanism.
